programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to actor and film-maker Kenneth Branagh In a wide-ranging conversation, Branagh reveals some of his most formative artistic experiences and his creative process. He remembers his working class upbringing in late 1960s Northern Ireland at the start of the Troubles, as explored in his most personal film to date, Belfast. Branagh also traces the beginnings of his love for Shakespeare back to the discovery of LP recordings of Laurence Olivier and John Gielgud, and reveals his admiration for Thomas Hardy and the Alan Bleasdale's 1980s television series The Boys from the Blackstuff

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.desc: A look at the bitter legal battle taking place for a decade over allegations of unlawful information gathering at some of Britain's biggest newspaper groups. programme.title: Sgeulachd Cogaidh na h-Artaig/Untold Arctic Wars
programme.desc: Documentary series that reveals the big picture of events in the Arctic during the Second World War. It shows the importance of the battles in that arena for the course of events for the war in general. The series dives deep into secret events and agreements between different parties, revealing the world-class game played in the Arctic. From the history research point of view, the Arctic is a gold mine - the area was a playground for a big political thriller centring around natural resources vital for the war industry

programme.title: Dealbh is Slighe

programme.title: Eadar na Dha: 1918-1935/Clash of Futures: 1918-1935
programme.desc: The Great War is finally over and a new era is about to start. Amidst the grief, disappointment and old fears, new dreams and hopes are now emerging but so too are new hatreds

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: China v Haiti (Kick-off 12.00pm). All the action from both teams' second Group D match, held at Hindmarsh Stadium in Adelaide, Australia. programme.title: James Martin's Great British Adventure

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray returns with the quiz in which three pairs of contestants use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to double the money they've banked earlier in the show or leave with nothing. This edition features friends Charlotte and Lucy from Manchester, auntie and niece Sarah and Alyson from South Wales, and London couple Uzo and Lola

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants - Deepak, Lynn, Franky and Nick - pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Lloyd suspects foul play, so he compiles a list of suspects and starts following the clues.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd always has Abacus over for dinner, so PB persuades Malcolm and Gena to let her invite Julie the Spider for dinner too. However, Lloyd's not convinced by Julie's promise not to eat them... and he decides to take precautions to ensure that his family don't become dinner!

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: While looking for Hawaii, Bugs Bunny accidentally finds himself in Ireland, where he encounters a magical angry leprechaun. / Marvin the Martian plants his flag on a new planet and claims it 'in the name of Mars,' but each time he does, something new and unexpected happens. / Porky is given a tour of the computerized house of the future, that misunderstands his commands and gives him a crazy time

programme.title: Mystery Lane

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef heads towards Louisiana's swamplands, where he ditches his car for a high-speed boat. Then, he travels to the nearby city of Lafayette, where he visits the family run smokehouse, Johnson's Boucaniere, and samples some of their traditional homemade sausage. James also tries ice cream from the legendary Borden's ice cream parlour, before heading back to the swamps to cook one final dish

programme.title: Jason Atherton's Dubai Dishes
programme.desc: The chef demonstrates recipes for breakfast and brunch, including a Spanish dish inspired by a full English, while chef Howard Ko shows off his truffle risotto with parmesan, which goes down a storm at brunch in Dubai

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the celebrity cookery series. This time, Joanna Page, Samia Longchambon and Claire Richards and their mentors take on the best of British as they battle to stay in the competition

programme.title: James Martin's Great British Adventure
programme.desc: The chef's countrywide tour brings him to London, where he stops off for a bite to eat at new restaurant Core owned by Clare Smyth, and visits a knife forge, where he learns the process of making Japanese-style knives. He also heads along the Thames to the village of Bray, home to the Waterside Inn restaurant. Here he catches up with old friends Michel Roux Sr and his son Alain

programme.title: ITV Racing Live

With analysis from Jason Weaver, reports by Oli Bell, Matt Chapman and Adele Mulrennan, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: The Living Daylights (1987)
programme.desc: James Bond crosses the continents to help a KGB agent to defect to the West. While protecting him from an unknown assassin, the super-spy is drawn into the world of arms dealing and a plot to trade millions of pounds' worth of diamonds for weapons to supply mercenaries around the world. Action adventure, with Timothy Dalton making his debut appearance as 007, alongside Maryam d'Abo, Joe Don Baker and Art Malik

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: Ian Wright hosts as three more teams of two try to bank money by dropping a ball from the Launcher onto an amount of cash. programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Chizzy Akudolu, Andrew Pierce, Sonja McLaughlan and Jack Carroll pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Irvine Welsh's Crime
programme.desc: Lennox interrogates Mr Confectioner and it is now a race against the clock to find Kylie as the suspect brings up the detectives drinking problem as he continues to toy with the police. programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Fast & Furious 8 (2017)
programme.desc: Street racing criminal Dominic Toretto is drawn out of retirement by an encounter with a ruthless cyberterrorist, who recruits him for an international criminal scheme. As he sets out to steal the technology she needs to unleash chaos on the world, he is drawn into conflict with both old enemies and his former gang. Action adventure sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Charlize Theron, Dwayne Johnson and Kurt Russell

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard asks the questions as Vernon Kay, Dion Dublin and Amanda Barrie answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: Paul Sinha's TV Showdown
programme.desc: Chaser, stand-up comedian and TV trivia genius Paul Sinha hosts this TV-themed comedy quiz show. Team captains Fay Ripley and Rob Beckett are joined by celebrity guests Chizzy Akudolu, Shirley Ballas, Roman Kemp and Iain Stirling to compete head-to-head and test their TV knowledge

programme.title: The Stasi: Secrets, Lies & British Spies
programme.desc: For nearly 40 years, East Germany's Stasi was one of the most formidable secret police forces in the world, with a vast network of spies and informers reaching across the globe until the fall of the Berlin Wall. As the Cold War ended, scores of them were still operating in the UK. With access to recently opened court files, Julie Etchingham reveals some of the Stasi's UK operations and asks why the identities of many alleged British informers are still a guarded secret 30 years after Germany made its file public

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Fishing Allstars
programme.desc: Dean Macey and Adam Rooney visit three diverse venues across England. They first target barbel on the River Trent alongside Matt Godfrey, before switching their attention to carp on the Grand Union Canal, and finally teaming up with Tom Dove and Steve Ringer at Earlswood Lake

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny Murphy attempts a bungee jump, seeing if he has the nerve to launch himself off the side of the Tees Transporter bridge

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd's plans with Abacus are ruined when he has to go on a family trip to Caterpillar World, but PB can't wait - she's finally going to find out the gory details of what happens inside a chrysalis! However, the show is not what either of them was expecting...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. PB has heard that there's a blob of peanut butter on the kitchen counter, but Lloyd's supposed to be maggotsitting and can't leave - faced with the prospect of missing out on the peanut butter, Lloyd therefore concocts a plan to take his maggotsitting duties with him!

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Porky Pig comes home in a panic and tells his roommate Daffy, that his pants are missing. Donning his fedora, Detective Daffy investigates the missing pants. / Tweety's trip to the veterinarian's office gives Sylvester the perfect opportunity for a lunchtime treat

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: After Elmer Fudd builds a robot to catch Bugs, the rabbit must outsmart this new technological foe. / Marvin the Martian plants his flag on a new planet and claims it 'in the name of Mars,' but each time he does, something new and unexpected happens. / Just as Elmer Fudd prepares for bed, all that stands in his way of a good night's rest is a persistent salesman Daffy Duck at his front door

programme.title: Mystery Lane
programme.desc: Animated series about a young guinea pig and her little brother, who look to solve police investigations. Detective McFlare is certain that the diamond thief who is currently terrorising London will come after the Queen's diamond next. But how can he protect the gem from an enemy described by guards' dogs as a 'shaggy-haired gnome who can teleport himself'?

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam botches her presentation of The Kanuktaka Harvesters, a board game she found in her gran's attic and fixed up. To make up for her mistake, she invokes the power to go back in time. But the process is uncontrollable and she and Mo end up stuck ten years in the past... before Sam was even born!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam invokes a power to rescue Hammy, who's stuck inside an air vent, but gets a word wrong when Mo interrupts her in the middle of the Scepter ritual! Sam asks for the power of the pickle... and brother and sister discover that whenever they move their hands, they fire off loads of mini pickles! They still have to recuperate Hammy, so Mo and Sam do their best to control their troublesome (and fairly useless) power at school, where they provoke a series of catastrophes.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer

programme.title: Katie Piper's Breakfast Show
programme.desc: The model and Loose Women panellist is joined by comedian Joe Pasquale and TV presenter Anna Williamson, with advice from expert Sali Hughes and something creative to try at home

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team go to Folkestone to create a sensory garden full of fun features for a five-year-old girl with a rare form of severe epilepsy. The quirky design incorporates a circular seating area with a vintage fireplace as a focal point, and uses special planting to bring the area to life

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Germany v Colombia (Kick-off 10.30am). Laura Woods presents live coverage of both teams' second match in Group H, held at Sydney Football Stadium in Australia. Two-time champions Germany entered the tournament as favourites to top this group, which also contains Korea Republic and Morocco. With analysis from Emma Hayes and Vicky Losada, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward

programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Three Men and a Little Lady (1990)
programme.desc: Bachelor Jack and his two best buddies have brought up his baby Mary since she was left in their care by her mother, Sylvia. Now that Mary is five years old, Sylvia believes she needs a more conventional upbringing and decides to accept a marriage proposal from an English aristocrat, leaving the trio of dads rushing to stop the wedding. Comedy sequel, with Tom Selleck, Ted Danson and Steve Guttenberg

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: Ian Wright hosts as three more teams of two try to bank money by dropping a ball from the Launcher onto an amount of cash. Husband and wife Ben and Helen are aiming for a round-the-world trip, lifelong friends Brian and Andy want to take a nostalgic golfing holiday in style, and mother-and-daughter Shan and Babs hope to take their family to Jamaica to see their relatives

programme.title: Licence to Kill (1989)
programme.desc: While on leave to attend the wedding of his friend, CIA agent Felix Leiter, James Bond is asked to help with a secret mission to capture notorious drug baron, Franz Sanchez. Though successful, Sanchez later escapes and seeks revenge on Leiter, killing his new bride and leaving Leiter for dead. Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bond's licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchez's drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. Spy thriller, starring Timothy Dalton, Robert Davi, Carey Lowell, Talisa Soto and Benicio Del Toro

programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: Ben Shephard asks the questions as Jonathan Ross, Katie Piper and Antony Cotton answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at autumn in the northern hemisphere and spring in the south, seasons of change that bring opportunities, but also huge challenges. By September temperatures in northern Canada can plummet as low as -20C, but there is one stretch of river that still flows and bears are able to fish for the final salmon of the season. In southern Africa the rains have been gone for many months and watering holes have all-but dried up, while a king penguin chick on Marion Island answers the call of the ocean

programme.title: A Spy Among Friends
programme.desc: Elliott and Lily, now working together since she alerted him that the CIA were about to step on his toes, follow Blunt to a clandestine meeting in the middle of the night with none other than MI5 director general Sir Roger Hollis. In Moscow, Angleton's CIA field agents are led into a trap by Philby

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ocean's 8 (2018)
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of brother Danny, light-fingered Debbie Ocean plans to steal the Toussaint, a $150million necklace from Vogue's Met Gala, with the 'help' of a famous actress. Crime caper, starring Sandra Bullock, Cate Blanchett, Anne Hathaway and Mindy Kaling

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follow the stories of two more people. Rachel Burch grew up in a white family and stood out in the small, West Sussex village where they lived, and is searching for her Jamaica-born birth father. Sue Davis is on the hunt for the half-brother her mother gave up for adoption after his American serviceman father went home and off the radar following Second World War

programme.title: Romeo & Duet
programme.desc: Oti Mabuse presents the dating show that uses the power of singing to help people find their ideal partners, with Adonye, Selina, Sven and Jessica taking part this time. Each of the singletons will be serenaded by up to four singers and if they like what they hear they make their way to the bottom of the stairs to choose their favourite, opening the door and locking in their choice before the performance comes to an end. Each of the four new couples then compete to be crowned the winners by the studio audience and bag themselves a second date

programme.title: The Stasi: Secrets, Lies & British Spies
programme.desc: For nearly 40 years, East Germany's Stasi was one of the most formidable secret police forces in the world, with a vast network of spies and informers reaching across the globe until the fall of the Berlin Wall. As the Cold War ended, scores of them were still operating in the UK. With access to recently opened court files, Julie Etchingham reveals some of the Stasi's UK operations and asks why the identities of many alleged British informers are still a guarded secret 30 years after Germany made its file public

programme.desc: While on leave to attend the wedding of his friend, CIA agent Felix Leiter, James Bond is asked to help with a secret mission to capture notorious drug baron, Franz Sanchez. Though successful, Sanchez later escapes and seeks revenge on Leiter, killing his new bride and leaving Leiter for dead. Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bond's licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchez's drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at autumn in the northern hemisphere and spring in the south, seasons of change that bring opportunities, but also huge challenges. By September temperatures in northern Canada can plummet as low as -20C, but there is one stretch of river that still flows and bears are able to fish for the final salmon of the season. In southern Africa the rains have been gone for many months and watering holes have all-but dried up, while a king penguin chick on Marion Island answers the call of the ocean

programme.desc: The duo are hired to investigate why newly planted roses at an upmarket preparatory school keep dying. Drama, guest starring Anthony Andrews (Brideshead Revisited), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Hollywood actress Marina Gregg and her director husband take up residence at Gossington Hall in the village of St Mary Mead and hold a reception to meet their new neighbours, including the hall's previous owner Dolly Bantry. The celebrations turn to tragedy, however, after a fan fatally drinks a poisoned cocktail apparently meant for the new lady of the manor. But a different picture begins to emerge as Marina spits out a similarly spiked cup of coffee on the set of her new film - and Miss Marple investigates the star's unhappy past. Julia McKenzie stars, with Lindsay Duncan, Nigel Harman, Joanna Lumley, Martin Jarvis, Hugh Bonneville and Michele Dotrice

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The detective investigates the disappearance of a Dutch au pair, which seems connected to rivalry amid the city's academics. His search leads him to a family estate in the Oxfordshire countryside where he meets three siblings divided by personal demons and shared loss. Endeavour suspects there is a link between the disappearance and an unsolved case from years before, but as the investigation continues, conflict erupts between his fellow officers. When a group of teenagers makes a horrifying discovery, he suspects someone is manipulating events from afar

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of killings in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. With help from sidekick Charlie Nelson, Barnaby tries to get to the bottom of the case, and unearths a long-held secret that takes him by surprise. With Rebecca Front, Andrea Lowe, Vincent Regan and Roy Hudd

However, secrets from the past surface after the murderer strikes again, and the repercussions are felt further than they were originally intended. With Neil Dudgeon, Neil McCaul, Sharon Small, Marc Elliott and Arabella Weir

programme.desc: The detective is distracted from a string of attacks on three wealthy farms by a series of anonymous phone calls from a man who claims a gang is trying to kill him. He and his trusty associates LaPointe and Janvier go in search of the caller, which leads them to the discovery of a body that has been dumped out of a car. Maigret is convinced the corpse is the man who phoned him - but his face has been mutilated, making it impossible to confirm his identity. Rowan Atkinson stars

programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: An archaeologist posing as Rosemary dies mysteriously during a dig for Anglo-Saxon artefacts in the grounds of Lord Engleton's stately home, presenting the duo with a fresh mystery to solve. programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley follows the Silk Road from the Black Sea to the Caspian Sea, travelling across the post-Soviet states of Georgia and Azerbaijan. From the seaside resort of Batumi, on Georgia's Black Sea, Joanna travels across the heart of the Caucasus region, passing through stunning mountain settlements, cities and vineyards, and finally the uber-modern city of Baku, the capital of oil-rich Azerbaijan. On the way she learns not only about the ancient Silk Road, but how these two very different countries are still finding their identities

programme.title: Live British Touring Car Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the 16th, 17th and 18th races of the season, which come from Croft. Jake Hill is now third in the championship standings after picking up two race wins last time out at Oulton Park, Ash Sutton tops the drivers' standings after winning six races from the opening 15 rounds, and reigning champion Tom Ingram is just six points adrift of the three-time BTCC champion. Steve Rider presents, with commentary by David Addison, Tim Harvey, Paul O'Neill, Richard John Neil and Phil Glew, and reports from Louise Goodman

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade visits southern Africa to see if he can track down a deadly fish that lurks in the eerie waters of the Okavango. A killer with shark-like teeth, there are stories of it hunting in packs and feeding on schooling fish or even human bodies. Jeremy is determined to find out if it is a giant piranha or something equally terrifying

programme.desc: Skipper Squizzy and Tabor are halfway through their five-day run. They have just 48 hours to hit their target - and then sell 500 kilos of lobsters direct to punters

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo's latest leg begins in the Italian fashion capital of Milan, where he visits an elegant cocktail bar who were the first to introduce the idea of the aperitivo in the city. Its train station is one of the busiest in Europe and it's from here he travels on to the town of Treviglio, the home of Bianchi bikes - the first mass-manufactured bicycle in the world. Gino gets a tour of the factory before test riding one of their latest electric bikes alongside a group of local cyclists. Moving on, he visits the medieval town of Bergamo, where he meets ice-cream maker Niccolo, and visits a co-operative restaurant

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape

He starts out angling for sardines, then takes his catch and prepares a dish of grilled fish for the passengers of Treno dei Sapore - a tourist train that takes guests along the lakeside and into the Franciacorta region. While they enjoy the views they also get a seven-course meal - with today's starter cooked by Gino

programme.desc: Carlos and Lucy think they have discovered a new third species of giant waterlily previously unknown to science, and they set about trying to prove their discovery to the world, with the help of their partners in Bolivia. Aaron is looking at ways to replace coffee plants threatened with extinction by climate change, pests and disease, while down at Kew's wild botanic garden Wakehurst, Katie and the tree gang have to deal with some invasive rhododendrons that are threatening the plant collection

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Susan Calman's Grand Week by the Sea
programme.desc: The comedian samples UK seaside resorts, beginning with Clacton-on-Sea, Essex. There she enjoys a whistle-stop tour of the largest pleasure pier in Europe. Susan takes a ride on a ferris wheel, and during theatre rehearsals for a summer show, she is picked to be a magician's assistant. Susan also meets up with actor and comedian Nina Wadia, who reminisces about her first trip to Clacton in her teens

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Part two of two. Concluding part of the series pilot in which John Dutton tries to protect his Montana ranch from land developers, an Indian reservation and America's first national park. Drama, starring Kevin Costner, Luke Grimes and Kelly Reilly

programme.title: Britain's Favourite 80s Songs
programme.desc: Jenny Powell narrates this look back at 1988, when Bros, Belinda Carlisle and Bomb the Bass were riding high in the charts, and Kylie Minogue went from soap icon to pop star. Toyah Willcox, Paul Gambaccini, Cheryl Baker and Sam Fox add their thoughts on the year when Fairground Attraction had a Perfect hit, the Hollies were back in the charts, and Yazz and the Plastic Population breathed new life into 1980 song The Only Way Is Up

programme.title: Queen: Rock the World
programme.desc: Documentary following the band as they recorded their sixth album, News of the World, and made plans for a tour of the US. Back in 1977, broadcaster Bob Harris was granted exclusive access, conducting interviews with all four members, as well as filming them at work in the studio, rehearsing their North American Tour. Until recently, the documentary was never completed and the footage lay unused in the archive. The film is supplemented by footage shot in the summer of 2017 as Brian May and Roger Taylor took Queen back to the US with Adam Lambert as lead singer

programme.title: Alex Polizzi's Italian Islands
programme.desc: The hotelier delves further into her heritage by exploring the culture, cuisine and history of the country's most beautiful islands. programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Documentary series catching up with native Britons who moved to Benidorm for some Spanish sun and a low-cost life. They include Essex lad Dean, who pays less than 300 a month for his bachelor pad and Val, who is the third-highest selling Avon rep in Spain - and has eyes on the ultimate accolade. Elsewhere, Wayne runs a cabaret bar as his drag alter ego Ms Levi G, and Liverpool crooner Eddie hopes to crack the local entertainment scene, but is under pressure to get gigs

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: The documentary following Brits who moved to Spain focuses on former miner Tad from Yorkshire who owns a handful of hostelries across Benidorm, dishing up English beer and food to Brits in the sun. Cameras also follow Dave, who supports his family with a variety of jobs, and scrimping pensioners Mo and Peggy, who flit between Benidorm and Bournemouth according to the weather

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Cameras follow 51-year-old Graham, entertainments manager of the popular Villamar campsite in Benidorm, who longs to be with his girlfriend Jackie 2,000 miles away in Northern Ireland. There's also a profile of Scouse singer Eddie who is trying to crack Benidorm's entertainment scene, and Amanda from Essex who makes her living selling and renting Benidorm apartments

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: With half-term approaching, Sue and Noel pull out all the stops to keep the children entertained. Meanwhile, there is a 'pie-off' on the seafront in Morecambe as Chloe and Noel fine-tune their recipes and try to impress some of the most discerning pie judges in the world, and Ellie has a sixteenth birthday she will never forget

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: A family trip to a theme park starts out as a lot of fun, but goes horribly wrong when Hallie and Phoebe go missing. Elsewhere, 11-year-old Tilly has a consultation at the hospital that she is really anxious about, and Noel shares a new plan to divide up household chores between the children

programme.title: Inside Legoland: A World of Wonder
programme.desc: It is autumn and everyone is racing to get the park ready for Halloween and the Bonfire Night fireworks spectacular - two of the most popular events in Legoland Windsor's calendar. While the entertainment team is busy choreographing and rehearsing dance and theatre shows, the 150-acre site must be given a suitably spooky makeover. In a specialist workshop, massive bespoke models are being designed and built especially for the Halloween celebrations, including gigantic LEGO pumpkins and massive LEGO spiders which, once completed to the Park's exacting standards, will need to be carefully suspended from the ramparts of the Resort's Castle Hotel

programme.title: Bicester Village: How Do They Really Do It?
programme.desc: Outlet centres across the UK are selling fashion at bargain basement prices, and Oxfordshire-based Bicester Village is top of the tree. Fashion experts, former employees and retail insiders reveal how it can sell premium fashion for less and uncover the secrets of its success

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Isle of Wight: Jewel of the South
programme.desc: It's Darcy Muncer's job to keep the island's hundreds of thatched properties looking top notch. Cameras follow him over a month as he restores an ancient, thatched roof, using skills and traditions that have remained unchanged for centuries. Meanwhile, in East Cowes, B&B owners Karl and David are preparing for the arrival of tourists Meryl and Dave from Wales

programme.title: When Fergie Met the Monarchy
programme.desc: If anyone should have been prepared for royal life, it was the Fergusons, with Prince Andrew and Sarah childhood playmates at Windsor Castle, and both families firm friends. This documentary examines the experiences of royal life for Sarah Ferguson and her family after she married Prince Andrew, and the impact on both sides after the marriage ended in scandal and divorce

programme.title: Buckingham Palace with Alexander Armstrong
programme.desc: The actor is joined by JJ Chalmers and Raksha Dave to reveal surprising stories about Buckingham Palace, examining the raucous balls thrown by first owners George III and Queen Charlotte, who purchased the residence as a rural retreat. Raksha gets glammed up Georgian-style to find out about the gossip and scandal that dominated the first parties hosted at Buckingham House, while Chalmers hits the dancefloor to trial some fancy footwork to impress the queen

programme.title: The Curse of Grace Kelly
programme.desc: A look at the privileged, but blighted lives of Princess Caroline, Prince Albert and Princess Stephanie, asking why they have been plagued by controversy and tragedy. Grace Kelly was killed in a car accident, and the ripples of such a devastating loss left their mark on all three of her children, including Caroline, who was thrust into first lady duties on the death of her mother, and has struggled to find happiness

programme.title: Greatest ABBA Cover Versions Ever
programme.desc: The stories behind well-loved versions of the Swedish group's songs, with music experts, fans and the performers themselves talking about what makes the originals so special. Featuring contributions by Dannii Minogue, Andy Bell of Erasure, Neil Arthur of Blancmange, Carla Bruni, Adrian Utley of Portishead, and producer William Orbit, who talks about a lost cover by Madonna.

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Flight

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe learns the truth about her father, while a malfunctioning radiator in Monica's apartment goes into overdrive, making her Christmas celebrations steamier than anticipated. Comedy, starring Lisa Kudrow and Courteney Cox

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dog handler Darren calls on all his powers of persuasion to try to end a roof-top stand-off, and Steve is forced to use his pepper spray when a suspect refuses to come quietly. Plus, there is a tense stand-off with a man armed with a knife

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Chris and the team are in pursuit of a stolen Mazda M3, but the driver disappears into an industrial area and tracker dog Ronny tries to track down the villain. Meanwhile, a routine stop and search takes a dangerous turn for Jimmy, and Liam helps take down a banned driver who causes carnage at a red light

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: Building works in the tower unearths some complete skeletons buried outside Henry VIII's chapel. Archaeologists examine the bones and attempt to uncover who these people were and how they came to be buried. Plus, the story of the tower during the Great Fire and a look at a handgun owned by Henry VIII, which provides an insight into the king's fascination with gunpowder weapons and its influence on the British war machine

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: The Tower plans its most ambitious installation for the first Platinum Jubilee in a thousand years and is turning the historic moat into a flower meadow

programme.title: Queen Victoria: In Her Own Words
programme.desc: Miriam Margolyes narrates an exploration of the queen's life through her diaries, journals and letters, as well as other items in the royal archives, revealing how she struggled to reconcile her different roles as monarch, wife and lover, as well as mother to a growing brood of children

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Dorset: Country and Coast
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh narrates a documentary exploring the rolling countryside, charming seaside towns and dramatic coastlines of Dorset, and examines the everyday lives of the people who live there, from locals to holidaymakers and farmers to wildlife conservationists. In the first episode, a 200-million-year-old fossil is found lying on a beach in Lyme Regis, and renowned chef and restaurateur Mark Hix MBE embarks on a fishing trip to catch sea bass to feature on his menu

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the secret of the supermarket chain's success. The programme examines the launch of a brand of organic food from Prince Charles' own duchy and reveals how the opening of a new Waitrose store has been known to boost house prices in the surrounding area. A taste test is performed to see how Waitrose's own brands compare to their rivals

programme.title: Million Pound Motorhomes
programme.desc: Simon and Julie take their daughter to Croatia for a cheerleading competition in their converted delivery van, while in America, Erick and Krystle show off their former bus, which inspired them to start their own conversion business for families with special sensory needs. Tomi Adebayo looks at three very different types of portable washing machines

programme.title: Coastguard: Search & Rescue SOS
programme.desc: A motor-powered yacht is in serious trouble off the south coast of England and the helicopter from Lydd in Kent is sent to help the two casualties on board the sinking vessel. A tanker is re-inspected by MCA surveyors in Teesport having been in dock for 15 days, while the Joint Rescue Co-ordination Centre in Fareham, Hampshire, receives a 999 call from a passer-by who can hear someone in distress under Bournemouth's Boscombe Pier

programme.title: Police: Hour of Duty
programme.desc: Officers rush to the scene of a fire at a block of flats, but when one resident fails to open their door, they are forced to take drastic action to avoid disaster. A high-octane police chase down a country lane has led to the arrest of a dealer who the police want to get off the streets, but when he refuses to comment under caution, will they have enough evidence to see him put away behind bars?

programme.title: Police Code Zero: Officer Under Attack
programme.desc: A single-crewed officer in north Wales spots a gang of suspected burglars making off in a powerful car, leaving PC Emma Birrell to give chase in a high-speed pursuit. In Hereford, police driving past a local nightclub spot a bouncer being verbally abused. They stop to help and PC Natasha Markham soon finds herself arresting the man, but he has no intention of going quietly and attempts to grab her crotch. When backup arrives, they take the man into custody, where the verbal abuse and assaults continue

programme.title: Surgeons: A Matter of Life or Death
programme.desc: Dan, 37, faces one of the hardest waits of his life. Diagnosed with primary sclerosing cholangitis - a disease that is causing his bile ducts and liver to fail - his only chance of survival is a liver transplant. A potential donor has been found, and now the race is on to assess the liver's viability. Once in surgery, Mr Bartlett works against the clock to quickly remove the old, diseased liver. But while trying to restore the blood supply to the new organ, there's a worrying lack of blood pressure

programme.title: Rich Holiday, Poor Holiday
programme.desc: Wealthy Cheshire entrepreneur Jude Cisse takes her family to experience a caravan break in Devon, and has trouble adjusting to the lack of privacy their crammed campsite provides. The hard-up McQueens from Peckham, who survive on dad Jay's 450 a week bus-driver wage, last went on holiday two years ago in a caravan on the South Coast. They take a trip to Jude's private, staffed villa in Morocco and are initially awe-struck at the luxury they experience

programme.title: Tribal Teens
programme.desc: British teenagers get the wake-up call of a lifetime as they are challenged to live among the world's toughest tribes, tasked to survive in some of the planet's most extreme and hostile environments. Unmotivated 18-year-old Ethan and 16-year-old pampered princess Alex are flown deep into the Peruvian rainforest, home of the Ashaninka tribe. There are no let-ups, no lie-ins and no luxury as the pair are forced to forage for food in the oppressively humid conditions with only the most basic of living conditions provided

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: House Doctor

Unfortunately, after four months on the market, there is still no buyer for the three-bedroom detached property - which comes complete with a wild colour scheme

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Rebecca is worried that, unlike the other engines, there is nothing special about her. She is later impressed by Belle putting out a fire

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Daring Danny X takes his horse off the trail and ends up on a wild ride

programme.title: Alpha and Omega (2010)
programme.desc: Humphrey the wolf is at the bottom of his pack's pecking order, and harbours a hopeless crush on Kate, the daughter of their leader. When the two animals are relocated by well-meaning park rangers, they must work together if they are to make it back to their natural habitat. Animated adventure, with the voices of Justin Long, Hayden Panettiere and Dennis Hopper

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 2 (2011)
programme.desc: Martial arts master panda Po continues to hone his skills when an evil peacock, who was banished from China for trying to build a deadly new weapon, returns to cause more chaos. It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman

programme.title: The Desert Rats (1953)
programme.desc: A Scottish army officer is placed in command of a unit of Australian troops given the task of defending Tobruk against overwhelming German forces, led by the renowned general Rommel. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Burton, Robert Newton and James Mason, reprising his role as Rommel from The Desert Fox

programme.title: Gunfight at the OK Corral (1957)
programme.desc: US Marshal Wyatt Earp lays down his badge to live a peaceful life with his brothers in the town of Tombstone. As a feud erupts with the ruthless Clanton gang, he forms an unlikely alliance with hard-drinking gambler Doc Holliday to face them in a historic showdown. Western, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas, Dennis Hopper, Lee Van Cleef and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: Oppenheimer Interview Special
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and director Christopher Nolan talk about making the historical dramatic thriller about J. Robert Oppenheimer

programme.title: The Mountain Between Us (2017)
programme.desc: An English neurosurgeon desperate to attend an operation crosses paths with an American bride-to-be determined to get to her wedding. When their chartered flight crashes, they attempt to survive in the wilderness, while fighting their attraction to each other. Romantic adventure, starring Idris Elba, Kate Winslet and Beau Bridges

programme.title: Alita: Battle Angel (2019)
programme.desc: In the 26th century, dismantled cyborg Alita is repaired by Dr Dyson Ido, a kindly technician with a dark secret. As she falls in love with local youth Hugo, the truth behind her mysterious past is eventually revealed. Director Robert Rodriguez's Sci-fi adventure based on the manga comic, starring Rosa Salazar, Christoph Waltz and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: Race with the Devil (1975)
programme.desc: Two couples embark on a road trip in a camper van. However, their holiday takes an unexpected turn when they witness a human sacrifice. When the local police find no evidence of the ritual, the holiday-makers continue on their way - only to be pursued and attacked by the Satanic cult responsible. Thriller, starring Peter Fonda, Warren Oates, Loretta Swit and Lara Parker

programme.title: Rosemary's Baby (1968)
programme.desc: A couple move into a new apartment, and the husband forms a close friendship with their elderly neighbours. The wife soon becomes pregnant, and starts to suspect her spouse has been seduced into a Satanic cult, who have sinister plans for her baby. Roman Polanski's horror, based on the novel by Ira Levin, and starring Mia Farrow, John Cassavetes, Oscar-winner Ruth Gordon, Sidney Blackmer and Ralph Bellamy

programme.title: The Pink Panther (1963)
programme.desc: The world's most inept police detective, Inspector Clouseau, heads off to Switzerland in search of a suave jewel thief who has purloined a priceless diamond from a princess - but the bumbling officer's every ruse to foil the crime ends in chaos, not least when he is framed for the robbery himself. Blake Edwards' comedy, starring Peter Sellers, David Niven, Capucine, Robert Wagner and Claudia Cardinale

programme.title: Little Monsters (1989)
programme.desc: Brian is a lonely 11-year-old who's just moved to Boston with his family. He's having a hard time making friends in his new neighbourhood, and to make matters worse, he wakes up one morning to find he's being blamed for a stack of pranks that he swears he hasn't done. However, a blue-skinned monster called Maurice soon changes his life forever. Comedy, starring Fred Savage, Howie Mandel and Daniel Stern

programme.title: Monsters vs Aliens (2009)
programme.desc: A woman is exposed to radiation from a meteorite that causes her to grow to an enormous size during her wedding. She is captured by the military and held prisoner with an assortment of strange creatures - but when aliens invade, these freaks of nature are the only ones capable of saving the world. Animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Reese Witherspoon and Hugh Laurie

programme.title: Angus, Thongs and Perfect Snogging (2008)
programme.desc: A 14-year-old girl struggles to cope with the torments of growing up, fitting in and finding a boyfriend. Tired of being a social outcast, she plans to throw the perfect birthday party to win the respect of her peers. Comedy drama based on Louise Rennison's series of novels, starring Georgia Groome, Alan Davies, Karen Taylor and Aaron Taylor-Johnson

programme.title: Congo (1995)
programme.desc: An expedition to find King Solomon's diamond mines in the jungles of the Congo disappears without trace. The tycoon behind the mission sends his assistant, a former CIA agent, to find out what became of the explorers - only to discover that the party met a grisly fate at the hands of a horde of vicious apes. Action adventure based on Michael Crichton's novel, with Dylan Walsh, Laura Linney, Tim Curry and Grant Heslov

programme.title: Mean Girls (2004)
programme.desc: A teenager is surprised when she is befriended by the girls in the most popular clique at her new school. However, a dating mishap leads to trouble and her supposed friends start to turn on her. Urged on by other pals outside their circle, the newcomer resolves to bring down the self-appointed queen of campus - only to end up adopting some of her rival's crueller characteristics. Comedy, with Lindsay Lohan, Rachel McAdams, Tina Fey and Lacey Chabert

programme.title: Event Horizon (1997)
programme.desc: A deep-space salvage crew investigate mysterious events aboard a hi-tech spaceship, which suddenly reappeared in orbit around Neptune after going missing for seven years - but it is not long before they are exposed to terror beyond their wildest nightmares. Sci-fi horror, starring Laurence Fishburne, Sam Neill, Kathleen Quinlan, Joely Richardson and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: After Blue (2021)
programme.desc: Katarzyna Buszowska, also known as Kate Bush, is an outlaw on a post-Earth colony in space inhabited by women. Among them is Roxy, a teenager who is ordered to hunt Katarzyna/Kate down. Sci-fi fantasy, starring Paula-Luna and Agata Buzek. In French, with English subtitles

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie (2004)
programme.desc: The plucky sea creature sets out to prove his boss Mr Krabs is innocent of stealing Neptune's crown. However, the missing item has ended up in sinister Shell City, which all sea-dwellers fear and from which few have ever returned. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny, Bill Fagerbakke, Clancy Brown and Scarlett Johansson, plus a cameo appearance by David Hasselhoff

programme.title: The Spiderwick Chronicles (2008)
programme.desc: Life for identical twins Jared and Simon and their sister Mallory begins afresh when their mother inherits a spooky mansion. But after moving in, strange things begin to happen, and as the youngsters investigate, they discover a book that opens up a mysterious world of amazing supernatural creatures. Fantasy adventure, starring Freddie Highmore in a dual role alongside Sarah Bolger and Nick Nolte

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain (2019)
programme.desc: Thanks to his race car driver owner, golden retriever Enzo learns that the techniques needed on the racetrack can also be used to successfully navigate the journey of life. Comedy drama, starring Milo Ventimiglia and Amanda Seyfried

programme.title: Deep Impact (1998)
programme.desc: A TV reporter investigating a presidential misdemeanour stumbles on evidence that a comet is on a collision course with Earth, threatening the future of the human race. Meanwhile, an astronaut prepares to lead his crew on a do-or-die mission to intercept the danger. Sci-fi drama, starring Robert Duvall, Tea Leoni, Morgan Freeman and Elijah Wood

programme.title: Skyscraper (2018)
programme.desc: A former hostage negotiator takes a job as a security expert at the world's tallest building in Hong Kong. He finds himself framed for sabotage when the skyscraper bursts into flames. As he strives to clear his name, he must also fight his way back into the blazing tower to rescue his family, who are being held hostage by criminals 225 storeys up. Action thriller, starring Dwayne Johnson, Neve Campbell and Chin Han

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow (2004)
programme.desc: A climatologist warns global warming will soon result in destructive freak weather, or even another ice age. He thinks the world still has time to prepare for the worst, but the crisis happens almost immediately - and as storms, earthquakes and hurricanes strike in terrifying fashion, he races across America to rescue his son from a frozen New York. Disaster thriller, with Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid

programme.title: World War Z (2013)
programme.desc: A virus sweeps across the globe, turning everyone infected into mindless, ravenous zombies. As entire countries fall into chaos, a United Nations investigator sets off on a journey around the world to discover the cause of the pandemic and hopefully find a cure before human civilisation is brought to an end. Thriller based on the novel by Max Brooks, starring Brad Pitt and Mireille Enos

programme.title: Vivarium (2019)
programme.desc: Young couple Gemma and Tom are keen to buy their first home together, but when they do, things take a strange turn. Sci-fi thriller starring Jesse Eisenberg and Imogen Poots

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes opens up about her feelings, and Tom embarrasses Yazz. Elsewhere, Peri asks for Prince to keep helping her find out more about Rayne

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Peri and Prince decide to team up to try and catch out Rayne. Meanwhile, Ste urges James to make things right with the McQueens

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay's next stop is Philadelphia, where family run restaurant Chiarella's is struggling to survive in an area full of thriving Italian eateries. Tommy and Dina Defino's marriage is on the verge of collapse and his sense of personal failure only adds to the troubles of their crisis-ridden business

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three previous restaurants he tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he heads for West Babylon, New York, where he helped the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts, before returning to Davide in Boston, an Italian restaurant run by two warring brothers. Finally, he visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island, run by hot-headed owner Abby

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The IRS accuses Sheldon of making a mistake and he stops at nothing to prove them wrong, while Dale is forced to get a colonoscopy and tries to convince Meemaw to join him

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Mary and Meemaw takes Brenda on a girls' night out, while Sheldon is caught in a moral dilemma when offered a bootleg copy of a computer game he cannot afford. Missy ask Georgie to take her and Marcus on a secret date

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Despite being on the International Space Station, Howard gets caught in a strange argument between Bernadette and his mother via video link. Elsewhere, Raj feels lonely while his best friend is away and ends up interfering with Sheldon's and Leonard's dates. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny tells the girls she is unsure about her relationship with Leonard and is considering breaking up with him, but when Sheldon finds out, he tries his best to change her mind. Meanwhile, on the International Space Station, Howard is being bullied by the other astronauts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay hopes for a quiet afternoon on the lake fishing, but his family has other plans involving fuss and thrills. Claire and Mitchell become trapped in their childhood home, Phil meets his arch-enemy from college at a shopping centre and Cam encounters a sticky situation at the bakery. Meanwhile, the children face the task of creatively editing their grandfather's birthday video

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The calamity-prone group visits a guest ranch where Mitch and Cam hope to rediscover their macho side, and a cowboy named Hank takes an instant shine to Gloria. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang goes to a bar and runs into Penny's old boyfriend Zack, while Bernadette is left to spend the evening with Sheldon when she cannot go wine tasting with the others. Elsewhere, things do not go to plan when Raj introduces his new girlfriend, Claire. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.desc: Sheldon discovers a surprise screening of The Avengers is scheduled at a local cinema, complete with a Q&A session with the film's director, Joss Whedon. Comedy, guest starring Christine Baranski

Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: The Butlers and Johnsons unite when a member of their community is the victim of racial injustice. American comedy, starring Cedric the Entertainer

programme.title: Modern Family

American comedy, starring Julie Bowen and Ed O'Neill

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: Sheldon agrees to participate in a series of short lectures at the university, but is worried the students dislike him. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon cannot contain his jealousy when he hears that his university colleague Bert has won a prestigious fellowship with an impressive grant. programme.title: Hollyoaks

Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg

programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose a date from six naked people whose bare bodies are revealed from the feet up. She is followed by 25-year-old tree surgeon Dmitri from Nottingham, who is looking for the perfect partner. However, once he picks his date, Dmitri is in for a big shock

Nameya is bisexual and hopes to find her perfect package in either a sexy guy or her first ever girlfriend. Next up is 35-year-old Dan from Bolton. Dan loves a fairy-tale but will her very own Prince Charming be standing behind one of the screens?

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Q, and Murr take to the court to serve up some seriously personal tennis lessons, and then head to the park for another game of 'Now!'

programme.title: Impractical Jokers

As this controlling bride struggles to hand over the reins, in a series first, the wedding plans are leaked and the couple are left facing the consequences

Family drama, starring Dakota Fanning and featuring the voices of Julia Roberts, Dominic Scott Kay, Steve Buscemi and John Cleese

With the time now served, he has returned, but must first regain his brother's trust before he can save their business

programme.desc: Anna Richardson hosts the show in which six potential dates bare all bit by bit in a bid to prove they are the one. She is joined by 28-year-old nature lover Oliver from Norwich, who has never had a girlfriend, and 48-year-old building boss Claire from Manchester. They will both choose a date after seeing what their potential partners have to offer on a purely physical level. But will they prove to be a good match?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics review Jamie's 1 Wonders, Married at First Sight Australia, Only Connect, Sex Actually with Alice Levine, Fall, Naked and Afraid, BBC News and ITV News

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall series turning the cameras on TV's most vocal armchair critics, as the show's regular gaggle of families, friends and viewing party acquaintances settle down to share their insightful, passionate and sometimes emotional critiques on Britain's Got Talent: The Champions, The Circle, Peaky Blinders, Strictly Come Dancing and Supermarket Sweep

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Songwriter Kristina meets wedding photographer Nicola, but flirtation turns to faux pas as the drinks flow, while cheeky charmer Billy tries to win over high-society make-up artist Olivia. Self-proclaimed geek James has a date with Holly, who is physically shaking with nerves when she arrives and is looking for someone to boost her confidence

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics review Jamie's 1 Wonders, Married at First Sight Australia, Only Connect, Sex Actually with Alice Levine, Fall, Naked and Afraid, BBC News and ITV News

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: John Paul struggles with the idea of reporting his attack to the police, while Peri and Prince want to help Romeo and set out to uncover Rayne's secrets

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp introduces new crafts, skills and techniques for interior decoration. In this edition, she reveals how to create a personalised doormat and coasters, using spray paint, old tiles and serviettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Gloucestershire couple Sarah and Simon fell in love with Fuerteventura 20 years ago and now they want to buy a holiday home there for three generations of their family to enjoy. Laura Hamilton shows them what their 200,000 budget can buy

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: As the end of the summer approaches, two gite owners in France prepare for their first guests, a business trio embark on a new venture in Spain, and a family-of-five seeks to find its dream home and business in Italy

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Max McMurdo and Simon O'Brien are in Woking, Surrey, where they find a sidecar - to be transformed into a boat - and a water cylinder that Simon might make into a trendy lamp

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Herefordshire to meet former farmer Julian. Henry finds an old cattle feeder that he wants to turn into a garden bench, while Simon hatches plans to turn a vintage seed drill into a trendy dining table

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers try to track down the relatives of a man who became estranged from his family and died without a will, and an heir embarks on a journey of discovery in a bid to understand his late cousin's secret involvement in the Cold War. Plus, more details of unclaimed estates

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The researchers try to track down the next of kin of a Newcastle man with a 100,000 estate who failed to leave a will, while another search unveils an intriguing story about London chimney sweeps in the early 20th century. Plus, details of unclaimed estates that are still in need of heirs

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The sports car-themed PitStop in Hertfordshire hosts the first round, as owners Melvyn and Sindy Rutter try to make a good impression. However, the absence of tea and coffee in the rooms does not go down well with the guests, and Melvyn's after-dinner talk about his collection of Morgan cars fails to spark much interest

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gill and Peter Tydie invite their fellow competitors to stay at the Victory in Mersea, Essex, a four-star B&B with 26 members of staff to run the bar, restaurant and accommodation. A trip to a local fishery gives one contestant an opportunity to annoy his peers, and the discovery of a hole in a bedsheet leaves the hosts feeling uneasy about their chances of success

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave Botha hosts at his Butterfly Paragliding B&B on the Isle of Wight. Deborah Morrison and Wayne Bingham are unhappy they must sleep in a tepee in the garden and use an outdoor toilet, and claim they were served watery eggs and rubbery sausages for breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Deborah Morrison and Wayne Bingham host the final night at Braddon Hall in Torquay, Devon, where Melvyn and Sindy take issue with their squeaky four-poster bed. The hoteliers try to entertain their guests by inviting them to take part in an archery contest - which ends in accusations of unfair play

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. One of the hosts gets upset about large underpayments and a couple interrogate their guests about the criticism in their feedback, before the winner is announced

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Chester Zoo's penguins move into a temporary home while a new luxury home is built for them, but the move becomes upsetting when malaria sweeps the colony, with elder Rudd battling to survive against the odds. Meanwhile, the African painted dog pups venture out of their den for the first time, but the runt of the litter Mosi refuses to go out into the cold, and keepers worry she may have issues with her eyesight. Elsewhere, Sumatran orangutan Emma gives birth, and a beetle with a wonky horn has to fight other bachelors in the group to win the attention of a female

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: It's the battle of the cutest as two very different puppies are offered to Sonia and Andy and their two little girls. Recovering from a broken leg, lurcher Manuel is potentially paired with paramedic Luke and partner Kath, while Lauren considers a life in the company of Winnie the Lhasa

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets energy conservationist Andrew, who has decided to build a radical, self-heating home for his family - the first of its kind in the UK. He aims to heat the house all year round by storing the warmth of the summer sun into insulated earth banks over and around the house, and then drawing the warmth back into the living spaces in winter. However, this pioneering construction seems an exercise in trial and error from the start, and what began as a seemingly simple, pure concept becomes a complicated feat of engineering

programme.title: Disturbing Disappearances
programme.desc: Esther Lewanski is leaving the police, but on her last day becomes worried about Julia, a young mother who has disappeared, abandoning her baby Zoe. Despite the team's and Esther's efforts, Julia can't be found and, at the same time, a girl, Charlie, is found drowned. What's the connection between these two young women? Crime drama, starring Alix Poisson. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Patients dealt with at King's College Hospital, London include a man who was stabbed in his own home and has injuries to his lung, arm and liver, and an elderly woman injured in a fall. A former international lawyer who lost his wife, family and home to alcoholism decides to make a change after being treated with care and compassion

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 77-year-old former motorbike racer arrives with a potentially deadly swelling of the main artery that could burst at any moment. His only option is major surgery, which could be dangerous at his age. A woman whose boyfriend was killed in a cycling accident a year previously is also injured while on her bike, and a medical technician and a mobile caterer talk about their roles in aiding people to recovery

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr invites Sean Lock and Miles Jupp to go up against Jon Richardson and Sara Pascoe in the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz. Sam Simmons joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Patients dealt with at King's College Hospital, London include a man who was stabbed in his own home and has injuries to his lung, arm and liver, and an elderly woman injured in a fall. A former international lawyer who lost his wife, family and home to alcoholism decides to make a change after being treated with care and compassion

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt finds out how much meat is in a sausage and how the great British banger got its name. Kate Quilton investigates orange wine and how it gets its colour, and Amanda Byram discovers the hi-tech solution to cutting a perfect slice of millionaire's shortbread

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Helen Lawal heads to one of the world's biggest coffee factories to find out how instant cappuccinos get their froth. Matt Tebbutt is in Naples to discover why most tinned tomatoes come from Italy, while Kate Quilton embarks on a panettone odyssey across Europe to learn how the fluffy cake lasts so long

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies is house-hunting on the beautiful island of Lanzarote with Richard and Catherine from Essex. They're eager to find a permanent family home in the sun that will offer daughter Jessica, who has chronic fatigue syndrome, and the whole family a better quality of life. They love the area around Playa Blanca, so Danni takes their budget of 300,000 to line up some tempting options

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Susan and her partner Ilse want a house in Spain with countryside views. Laura Hamilton shows them five options around the towns and villages of the Costa Tropical for their budget of 200,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lisa and daughter Jordan are searching for their dream holiday home around the beautiful inland villages of Andaluca. They particularly love the town of Velez-Malaga, so Jonnie Irwin lines up five properties in the area for their budget of 75,000. They have set their sights on a traditional Spanish property with a modern twist, so will Jonnie be able to deliver?

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Liam Charles and Ellie Taylor challenge six new teams to produce 36 perfect Prinsesstrta alongside a chocolate amenity with no recipe to help them. The contestants then transform a classic dessert into a fine-dining experience, taking the humble bread and butter pudding and turning it into a towering, edible, showpiece sculpture

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first host in Devon, 35-year-old salon owner Hannah, hopes to impress her guests with a menu bursting with taste sensations. But Hannah's technique of combining her favourite flavours may not tickle all of her foodie guests' taste buds. Hannah's night is filled with laughter and revelations, though there is an inkling around that her food is not tasty enough

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The second dinner party in Devon is hosted by funeral director and BMX fanatic Simon, who hopes his big portions and 'man food' will win him the cash prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Body artist Pascale hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Devon, preparing a Vietnamese menu full of flavour and colour in an effort to impress her guests enough to win the 1,000 prize money. However, her cooking attire for the starter leaves little to the imagination, Nick and Simon find some unusual artwork in her bedroom, Hannah discovers an unwanted guest in her main course, and Nick hits a nerve with Ajay

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nick hosts the fourth night in Devon, preparing a menu that he hopes represents his personality - big, bold and brash - although after his argument with Ajay, he is planning on turning down the banter. However, salon owner Hannah is not impressed with Nick's venison main and ladybird-loving Pascale finds the portions a bit too big. But undertaker Simon is happy to polish off any leftovers - is Nick in with a chance of bagging the 1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Ajay hopes her nautical-themed evening will see her sail to victory on the fifth and final night in Devon. Along with a gigantic seafood spread, she has also laid on a boat trip around Torquay harbour. However, all does not go quite to plan in the galley. The guests later gather to discover who has won the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Simon White and Shirley Boyle, owners of the Old Hall Country House in Madeley, Cheshire, host the week's first round of the B&B competition. The guests are impressed by the 16th-century building, and are taken tap-dancing and to a private fine-dining restaurant, but one of them is dissatisfied with her bedroom's layout and the garnish on her eggs at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Eileen Finn invites her fellow contestants to the four-star Thornley House in Allendale, Northumberland, for the second round of the contest, but struggles to follow the impressive first event. The hostess's pet cats are not to all of her guests' liking, and with activities including a tour of a feline cemetery, the theme for the stay is made abundantly clear

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jessica and Adrian Rashleigh are the third hosts, at their three-bedroom establishment Chy Conyn in St Ives, Cornwall. For the activity they arrange a magical mystery camper van tour of the local sights. Some of the guests struggle with the small breakfast room but the food is a success, and Eileen Finn demonstrates her karate skills on the men

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at the Cavendish in Bournemouth, run by Tim and Karen Sturgess. However, Eileen is delighted by the feline memorabilia in her room and the group enjoys a spot of indoor paint-balling and an open-top bus tour of the resort

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Simon White of Old Hall Country House is surprised by an overpayment and Eileen Finn from the four-star Thornley receives tough criticism, before the winner is announced

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Mark Evans meets more people who aspire to live in their ultimate waterside dream home. Simon and Mary Sparrow live on a barge in Beccles, Suffolk, with their son Nate and their two cats. The Sparrows have been running a boatyard for nearly 10 years, specialising in refurbishing and renting out floating homes to holidaymakers. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The medical team faces a range of sport and drink-related injuries on a busy Saturday, including two women hurt when the bar they were dancing on collapsed, and a bricklayer badly cut in an attempted mugging. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The A&E staff of King's College Hospital in London treat patients involved in accidents, including a construction worker who broke his leg in three places and suffered injuries to his chest after being trapped under a cherry picker. programme.desc: The medical team faces a range of sport and drink-related injuries on a busy Saturday, including two women hurt when the bar they were dancing on collapsed, and a bricklayer badly cut in an attempted mugging. programme.desc: The A&E staff of King's College Hospital in London treat patients involved in accidents, including a construction worker who broke his leg in three places and suffered injuries to his chest after being trapped under a cherry picker. Plus, a man who fell from a ladder and landed on his head, and a widower who had a nasty encounter with a mandoline while chopping vegetables

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty is in Thailand asking how the blossom from a banana tree is shaking up fish and chip suppers. Matt Tebbutt visits Spain to find out how the delicate raspberry gets from fields to fridges without turning to mush, and Andi Oliver heads to an onion factory to see how the eye-watering vegetables are peeled on a gigantic scale
