programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: Tim and Emily fell in love with their 16th-century, Grade II-listed Cotswold cottage on first viewing, despite an abundance of dark beams, low ceilings and woodchip. For George, the project is his oldest house yet. And In Kent he tackles an oast house. Can he design a super cool bedroom for eight-year-old Bella in this unusual tower?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Flamboyant 49-year-old performing arts teacher Helen gets the party started in Sheffield. Her cooking doesn't go to plan, but she certainly delivers on the entertainment, on a whirlwind evening featuring trumping, spies and a dessert that goes with a bang

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Design and technology teacher Claire hosts the second day of the competition in Sheffield, and hopes her Asian-inspired menu with a spot of clay model-making will impress her fellow diners enough to net her the points she'll need to secure the cash prize. However, former chef Simon Hollings proves difficult to faze, and the eccentric Helen irritates the other contestants with another audacious display at the dinner table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Service administrator Monika hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Sheffield. She treats her guests to a traditional Bulgarian night inspired by her homeland, in the hope of impressing them enough to win the 1,000 prize money. However, some of the guests are unsure about her Bulgarian delicacies, and the host must fight for control when the two teachers go head to head and when Simon makes sexist jokes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: After tensions arose between Claire and Helen on Monika's night, 1980s musician Ivor is determined to serve up some fun on his evening in Sheffield. He stages an '80s extravaganza, including a live performance from his new romantic band My Pierrot Dolls

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former chef Simon hosts the final meal in Sheffield, but is unlikely to get an easy ride from his guests following all the criticism he has dished out at the earlier soirees. He also has to contend with the feud that's brewing between Claire and Helen, and when things boil over between the women, Monika doesn't know where to hide

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mark and Kathy Domaille, owners of Godshill Park Farm on the Isle of Wight, host the week's first round of the B&B competition and invite their guests to take part in clay pigeon shooting. However, dust behind bath taps, a lack of coat-hangers and a breakfast that does not meet expectations take the shine off their stay

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Teresa and Clive, owners of the Butterfly Guest House in Porthcawl, south Wales, host the next round of the competition, but their status as beginners is confirmed when one couple find hairs in the bathroom. Another pair are shocked to discover there is no view of the sea from their window, but things liven up when the guests go bowling and attend a surprise karaoke party

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Kalpana and Joseph's four-star townhouse in Blackpool, the Address. Cumbrian farmers Ruth and Mike are unhappy their room overlooks a car park and security light, and a trip to the Pleasure Beach results in Teresa calling Mark and Kathy a miserable couple

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competitors head to Cumbria to visit Mike and Ruth's four-star gold-rated Crake Trees Manor. Two of the guests are looking forward to their stay in the plush building, until they discover they have been allocated outdoor accommodation without electricity, water or a toilet

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Mark and Kathy of Godshill Park Farm receive some underpayments, and accusations of game-playing abound before the week's winner is announced

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Julie hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham, hoping to win over her guests with a no-nonsense menu she can prepare in advance. Joining her are tough-talking prison transport officer Tina, dreadlocked farm-dweller Stephen, superior IT manager David and glamorous beauty-school teacher Ashleigh. Alliances are quickly forged when David and Tina discover they both love a good gossip, before they turn their attention to Stephen when David compares him to a tramp. Julie overcooks her beef, but will her hosting make up for it and bag her the 1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beauty teacher Ashleigh throws the second of the week's parties in Co Durham, she hopes a menu of sophisticated dishes - along with a helping of hearts and love - will help her win the cash prize. However, cracks were already beginning to show in the diners' genial facade yesterday, and the hostess realises she must play peacemaker if she is to keep everyone from falling out

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Call centre complaints officer and part-time farmer Stephen hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham. He hopes to win the 1,000 prize money by impressing his guests with an evening on his farm, featuring a drinks reception and rustic cuisine. However, self-confessed snob Tina makes it perfectly clear what she thinks of his efforts

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Prison transport officer Tina is the fourth host in Co Durham. She hopes to impress her guests with a sophisticated French menu including salmon crepes, chicken and posh peas and pear dessert. But having been highly critical of everyone else's food so far, will they now take the chance to get their own back or can she win them round?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final evening of gatherings in Co Durham sees IT manager David stage a French-themed soiree in the hope of securing the 1,000 prize. However, he soon finds his main challenge is to keep all his guests on friendly terms

programme.desc: A retired dockworker who suffers from diabetes is brought in with severe stomach pain and doctors believe part of his gut may have permanently stopped working, creating a life-threatening situation where immediate surgery is the only option. programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Mya's stabbing victim is hanging onto life as he bleeds heavily. Dr David's patient has potential spinal injuries after landing on his head during a mountain bike race crash. Milo is a hit with Dr Emma during bring your dog to work day

programme.desc: In Cambridgeshire, the heli-medics race to treat a young cyclist with a time-critical brain injury. On the Norfolk Broads, holidaymaker Tom breaks his thigh bone jumping off a boat, while Cedric, an 87-year-old pilot, is put into an induced coma after he crashes his microlight in Cumbria

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: The team needs to quickly discover the truth behind a college student's unexplained injuries before his condition worsens. Medical drama, with Freddie Highmore

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Mya's stabbing victim is hanging onto life as he bleeds heavily. Dr David's patient has potential spinal injuries after landing on his head during a mountain bike race crash. Milo is a hit with Dr Emma during bring your dog to work day

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A retired dockworker who suffers from diabetes is brought in with severe stomach pain and doctors believe part of his gut may have permanently stopped working, creating a life-threatening situation where immediate surgery is the only option. Other patients include a man who has twisted his knee dancing in a club, and a cyclist brought in unconscious after falling off his bike

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is in Spain learning why some oranges are so hard to peel, while Jimmy Doherty heads to Thailand to discover why coriander is the herb of choice for some, but for others it seems to taste like soap. Briony Williams finds herself in a bit of a jam as she interrogates an important kitchen conundrum - why dropped toast always lands the wrong side down

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Following the work of Yianni Charalambous, car customiser for the rich and famous. In the first episode, Yianni has to get a hybrid supercar ready in under a week

programme.desc: This time, car customiser Yianni Charalambous works on a tour bus owned by his friend, DJ Charlie Sloth. Contains suitable for all

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May are challenged to create a TV advert for Volkswagen, but soon fall out as James concentrates on detailed information on fuel economy and Jeremy wants something more exciting. Richard Hammond explores an alternative to Germanic sports saloons and tests the Vauxhall VXR8 Bathurst, and former US chat show host Jay Leno is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Two 16-year-olds are suspected of smuggling drugs for a cartel. A man tries to enter the US with false documents. Marijuana worth $7million is found inside rolls of carpet.

programme.desc: John Mackie takes on a hellish loco restoration job, Wilmar Sugar race to repair cyclone-destroyed tracks, and an upstart freight company takes on Broken Hill's mineral riches

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gino D'Acampo returns to explore more of his native country, this time heading off the beaten track to meet people keeping age-old traditions alive, as well as showcasing the scenery and culture of these lesser-known parts of Italy. He begins in the central state of Abruzzo, learning about chitarra pasta, before heading along the historic Trabocchi coastline to meet a fisherman whose family use a traditional wooden machine for their livelihoods and then travelling into the mountains to meet Mauro, a farmer who also trains the local breed of sheepdog

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo heads to the northern state of Trentino Alto-Adige, which borders both Switzerland and Austria and is home to the Dolomite mountains. The chef meets dairy farmer Graziano, who shows him how to make a local soft cheese, before he moves further into the mountains to learn about the local cured meat known as speck, which is the most important produce to come out of the region. Gino finishes his journey in a picture postcard location where he whips up an apple strudel with a twist

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Buckinghamshire

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the auctioneers arrive in Royston, Hertfordshire where things get out of hand as Heavy D drives everyone round the auctioneering bend

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John Heussi rebuilds the force's beat car. Meanwhile, an old patrol car turns up in the Czech Republic

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to discover if they can go motor racing for less than it costs to play golf. There's also a double helping of guests, with rock star Slash and Formula One driver Kimi Raikkonen taking to the track in Reasonably Priced Cars. Richard also gets behind the wheel of the BMW M5, which is powered by a twin-turbo V8 engine instead of the high-revving V10 of its predecessor

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May are challenged to create a TV advert for Volkswagen, but soon fall out as James concentrates on detailed information on fuel economy and Jeremy wants something more exciting. Richard Hammond explores an alternative to Germanic sports saloons and tests the Vauxhall VXR8 Bathurst, and former US chat show host Jay Leno is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.desc: BBC Breakfast's Naga Munchetty, singer and actor Jordan Stephens, presenter and actor Sally Lindsay and comedian David O'Doherty go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games, vying to be crowned weekly champion

Loved by the likes of Greta Garbo, Charlie Chaplin and Auguste Escoffier there's still a cornucopia of choice for those with a more traditional temperament with eisbein, meatballs and sausages topping every menu in the German capital

programme.desc: In Montreal, Michael Portillo discovers how French and British colonial roots have influenced the city's construction, cuisine and culture. In the Canadian capital, Ottawa, Michael visits the country's parliament to hear about the birth of the new nation after Confederation in 1867. And at Ottawa's historic Central Experimental Farm, Michael hears of the pioneering discoveries, which launched a Canadian wheat boom

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by actress and comedian Morgana Robinson for a two-day break in the Italian city of Milan, taking in art, pasta, the bowling game of bocce, and a drink in Backdoor 43 - a tiny bar that can hold a maximum of four customers at a time. At a viewing of Leonardo da Vinci's The Last Supper, Richard finds the painting to be quite good, but Morgana thinks it's 'no Tracey Emin'. programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops at Mattoon, Illinois, where he gets a taste of the early life that shaped President Abraham Lincoln, though struggles to split one rail compared with Lincoln's estimated 700 a day. The political pundit then heads to Kentucky, where a bloody conflict proved decisive in victory for Lincoln's Union. Aboard a paddle steamer on the lower Mississippi, Michael hears about the life of former river boat captain Samuel Clemens, better known as Mark Twain, and in Memphis, Tennessee, uncovers the story of a devastating epidemic. In the home of the Blues, Michael joins some Elvis fans at Graceland

Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Amy, director of the country office, visits a 1930s property in Surrey boasting eight acres of award-winning grounds, an on-site recording studio, circular rooms, horizontal curved windows and terraces with views of the gardens. Once belonging to Roxy Music guitarist Paul Manzanera, it's an exciting listing for Amy who is on the hunt for a buyer willing to pay 5.45million or a tenant with 20,500 per month to spend. Mo entrusts Natalie with a new listing - an enormous three-storey converted factory in the heart of Spitalfields worth 2.3million. programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George tackles a cottage conundrum, the previous owner has removed all the upstairs walls. He plans to create two more bedrooms and add a bit of privacy. Plus, he meets a couple who have plans to turn their loft into a cinema room

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Greater Manchester, the first host, 55-year-old DJ and hairdresser Mozz from Bury, makes garlic Stilton mushrooms and poached pear, and pulls out all the stops with a party atmosphere and his entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Manchester, voiceover artist and film extra Matt cooks up a Jewish Friday night supper, including his mum's traditional chicken soup

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Budding author and mum-of-five Cleona is next to host in Manchester, hoping a menu based on her Jamaican roots will get her guests onside

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Australian radio content director James hosts the fourth party in Manchester, hoping his menu containing Chinese cuisine and his mum's cake recipe can land him the top spot

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Events boss Sharon hosts the final night in Manchester. With her hearty decadent menu on offer, she has to win over Cleona after a bust up on from Cleona's turn as host. Sharon's skills and decorum are put to the test, though Mozz, Matt and James are on hand for moral support

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first destination of the week is the Old Rose & Crown in Lickey, Birmingham, where guests have some problems with the paintwork and are missing fresh milk

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Middlewick in Glastonbury, Somerset, run by Jill Barker and Inez Findlay, who hope their famously mystical location will enchant their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Griffin Inn, in Irnham, Lincolnshire, where hosts Jamie and Leila Benton Jones invite the B&Bers to their very own village, steeped in history

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Crossroads House owned by Julie and Alistair Musgrave, who pride themselves on their full English fry-up and Cumberland banger. Jamie and Leila are surprised by the B&B's roadside location but impressed by their newly spick-and-span room, while Jill and Inez dig into the mismatched decor in theirs. At drinks, Julie and Alistair reveal their entrepreneurial ambitions and are confident their breakfast offering will bring home the win. In the morning, Jamie and Leila are feeling rough after a restless night whilst in the kitchen Julie is experiencing a last-minute crisis of confidence

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to trade feedback, starting with The Old Rose & Crown, where Jamie and Leila lay into the linen. The B&Bers discuss lukewarm reactions to the facilities, problems with paying for breakfast and picky comments about the paintwork. Things take an emotional turn when Julie and Alistair chew over their bad breakfast score. There are harsh truths, heated debates and disagreements as the payments are revealed before the winner is finally announced

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sophie and Charlotte hunt for the perfect property for sunbathing and golf with sisters Shirley and Pam, while Sharon and Steve search for a client's forever home

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and Steve Garner are looking for the perfect home in the Spanish sun for NHS worker Jo and marine upholsterer Lee from Southampton. Armed with a 300,000 budget the pair search for a three bedroom property with outside space for their dog and a workshop space for Lee's business in Almeria. In Alicante, Sophie and Charlotte Rodriguez hunt for a getaway in the sun for Susan and James from Glasgow who have a budget of 200,000, a dislike for terracotta and a love of all things modern

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help a married couple decide where to spend their retirement. Gail wants to return to her roots and move to the west coast of Scotland, but Clive is craving some sun and likes the look of southern Spain

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: After a long-term relationship came to an end and her son flew the nest, Alix Sinclare sold her family home in Devon. She's now looking for the perfect place to start a new life but cannot decide between current home in Teignmouth, Devon, and Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin offer advice, with Jonnie anxious to convince her that Spain is the place to be

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: North Wales couple Rebecca and Carl want to find their very own bolthole in Gandia, Valencia, that will start as a holiday home but one day become a permanent home. With their children now grown up, they feel now is the right time to make the move. Ideally, they want enough land to grow their own fruit and veg and to be near the beach, so Rebecca can collect shells and stones that inspire her craft jewellery business. Armed with a budget of 80,000, Jean Johansson shows them five properties for them to consider

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Newlyweds Debbie and John have decided that it's time to say goodbye to their busy careers in healthcare in Wales and live the good life on the sunny Costa del Sol. Together with their much-loved dogs, Dolly and Betty, they want a 'forever home' in Benalmdena. With a budget of 250,000 and expert help from Jean Johansson, they set out to find a dream home to start married life in Spain

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George heads to Kent to help Pete and Amelie make their huge 16 room Victorian house fit for modern life, with plans to make a playroom and a library. Amelie makes a trip to Shropshire to make her own encaustic tiles in one of the last remaining factories in the country to use traditional methods. Plus, George revisits Michele in Warwickshire to see how she is getting on remodelling her adjoining Grade II listed cottages

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of private chef Ed Versluys and pilates instructor Vicky Anderson, who want to convert a concrete cowshed in the Somerset countryside into a three-bedroom home. With the help of one young builder and the knowledge they can learn from the internet, the couple plan to project manage the conversion themselves. However, they have only eight months and a budget of just over 200,000 to make a warm and comfortable home with straw bale walls and wide expanses of glass

programme.title: Micky Flanagan: The Out Out Tour (2011)
programme.desc: A performance by the comedian from his sold-out nationwide tour of 2011. He tells the story of his upbringing in London's East End and a childhood in which alphabetti spaghetti was a luxury, along with his rise to fame, making razor-sharp observations about the British class system along the way

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.desc: Conrad and Michelle meet in Florida and discover a connection that will follow them back to their respective towns in Massachusetts. Michelle honours Conrad's memory, while the police review their text exchanges in the months leading up to his death

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: Mother and daughter Ruth and Lucy Hinch welcome their rivals to Rutland Luxury Lodges in Greetham, where the guests are relieved to find luxury in abundance - and Laurence is impressed with the stand-out breakfast sausage. However, something is missing for Simon

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Recently retired couple Nick and Jane Purser are looking forward to settling down, but cannot decide where that should be. Jane's mother lives in Liverpool, so she would prefer to stay close by with a move to Lancaster. Nick wants them to move to southern France, where he can ride his motorbike in the sun. programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: When her partner of 20 years died, Ginny Lunn decided to find a holiday home where she could create new memories. Jasmine Harman shows her three options in Dorset, and Laura Hamilton tries to impress her with three properties in Spain, but, with the help of her sister Sara, which one will Ginny choose?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Steph, who works in recruitment, and Gordon, a recently retired insurance broker, have been married for 33 years. On the coast in Newquay, a 12-year-old boy on a cub scout 'coasteering' trip has fallen badly and has suspected spinal damage, while volunteers at Eastbourne lifeboat station recover the body of someone who has taken their own life

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: Angus Ashworth heads to Bradford to look through a vast collection of coins, toys and jewellery. Plus, the team clear Yorkshire-made furniture from a beautiful cottage

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Serhat Ahmet and Catherine Southon start the final lap of their antiques race on the bumpy backroads of Lincolnshire, heading to their final destination of Silverstone - the home of the British Grand Prix - in Northamptonshire. On their travels, Catherine discovers the history of the most iconic of classical instruments at a school that teaches students how to make them. Meanwhile, Serhat hears the story of how a group of enterprising 18th-century miners helped turn a peak in Derbyshire into one of the country's earliest tourist attractions

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Serhat Ahmet head to south Wales. There's a mad dash around the shops as Serhat tries to eke out his tiny budget, while Christina struggles to blow all of her money. They look at baths, buckets and big sticks to try to turn a profit at the auction. Serhat follows in the footsteps of two brothers who discovered a whole underground world beneath their farmland, while a trip to a spa doesn't turn out quite as expected for Christina as she takes the plunge into a rather weird and wacky sport

programme.title: Ghost Adventures

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Skysurfer Strike Force

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: Exploring Hitler's range of bomb and bullet-proof Mercedes cars, which saved his life on numerous occasions

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: In Pembrokeshire, Kate meets the last master thatcher based in Wales. She also helps with the harvesting of water reeds - an invasive, thick grass-like plant now used on 80 per cent of thatched roofs in the UK. In Pendine Sands, Kate joins a cross-country hunt adapted for modern times and struggles to stay on the horse as they chase hounds who have been specifically trained to only pick up on human scent. Finally, Kate and Teg visit an agricultural college that helps neuro-diverse students thrive through a deep connection with the land

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring Camberwell and Mottingham for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.title: Royals and Animals: Til Death Do Us Part
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the extraordinary relationship between the Windsor's and their animals

programme.title: Tiara Tahiti (1962)
programme.desc: Two chalk-and-cheese British Army officers decide to settle a long-standing grudge in a Tahitian resort during peacetime. Comedy, starring James Mason and John Mills

programme.title: A Kiss Before Dying (1956)
programme.desc: A psychopathic college student is horrified to learn his girlfriend is pregnant, threatening his chances of being accepted into her well-to-do family. In a fit of fury, he murders her and makes it look as if she had committed suicide - only for her sister to show up, taking an uncomfortable degree of interest in the manner of her sibling's death. Thriller, with Robert Wagner, Joanne Woodward, Jeffrey Hunter and Mary Astor

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: In Pembrokeshire, Kate meets the last master thatcher based in Wales. She also helps with the harvesting of water reeds - an invasive, thick grass-like plant now used on 80 per cent of thatched roofs in the UK. In Pendine Sands, Kate joins a cross-country hunt adapted for modern times and struggles to stay on the horse as they chase hounds who have been specifically trained to only pick up on human scent. Finally, Kate and Teg visit an agricultural college that helps neuro-diverse students thrive through a deep connection with the land

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: Sheltering from a blizzard in a cave, Monkey tries to trick Pigsy into sacrificing himself to save Tripitaka's life. Cult adventure, starring Masoaki Sakai and Toshiyuki Nishida

programme.title: Aging in the Wild
programme.desc: Documentary revealing what it is like for animals to grow old, looking at longevity, reproductive health, social status, wisdom and eventual death, as well as examining the unique challenges every species face in the ageing process

programme.title: The Informers (1963)
programme.desc: The murder of a Scotland Yard informer starts a trail of deceit and intrigue among London's underworld, prompting a police inspector to conduct his own unorthodox investigation. Thriller, starring Nigel Patrick, Margaret Whiting, Colin Blakely and Derren Nesbitt

programme.title: Dulcima (1971)
programme.desc: A girl treated as a drudge by her family lifts herself from her environment by becoming a housekeeper. Drama, starring John Mills, Carol White and Stuart Wilson

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London icon the Golden cycling man of Wimbledon gives his first ever public interview

programme.title: The Maids (1975)
programme.desc: Two maids hate their employer, so whenever they are alone in the house, they indulge in a sexual roleplay fantasy in which they take turns dressing up as her, so the other can pretend to murder her. Drama based on Jean Genet's stage play, starring Glenda Jackson and Susannah York

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: News and events from across London from the past few days

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend.

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: How Hitler used bombs, dummy aircraft and an escape hatch to help him survive

programme.title: Castle Builders
programme.desc: How castles changed from being siege-proof fortresses to places of ceremony and fantasy, with reference to the rebuilt Windsor Castle as a notable example

programme.title: The Rocking Horse Winner (1949)
programme.desc: A boy develops a knack for predicting racing results while riding his toy horse, but his talents are abused by his greedy mother, ultimately leading to tragedy. Drama, starring John Mills, Valerie Hobson and John Howard Davies

programme.title: The Waterbabies (1978)
programme.desc: A runaway chimney sweep flees from his wicked master and stumbles across a strange underwater kingdom. As he tries to return to his own world, he discovers he must first save a group of water babies from a deadly foe. Children's adventure based on the novel by Charles Kingsley, starring James Mason, Billie Whitelaw and Tommy Pender

programme.title: The Trap (1966)
programme.desc: A woman is sold to a trapper in 19th-century British Columbia and reluctantly becomes his wife, overcoming her initial fears to nurse him through an illness. Drama, starring Oliver Reed, Rita Tushingham and Rex Sevenoaks

programme.title: The Cup (2011)
programme.desc: Australian jockey Damien Oliver prepares to follow in his father's footsteps and compete in the 2002 Melbourne Cup. However, the weeks leading up to the event are rocked by tragedy for both Oliver himself, who faces a death in the family, and for the nation in the wake of the Bali bombings. Fact-based drama, starring Stephen Curry and Brendan Gleeson

programme.title: The Great Way
programme.desc: Alba and Raul start their journey around the world greatest walking trails, a journey that will take them from Japan to Peru, passing through the United States

programme.title: The Lion Queen
programme.desc: New arrivals put added pressure on limited resources as two rescued lions arrive at Glen Garriff. A male, called TJ, is unwell and requires the vet, while a cub is mauled by one of the lions

programme.title: Everything Must Go (2010)
programme.desc: A man's heavy drinking costs him his job and leads to his wife kicking him out of the house. He sets up home on their lawn, amid all the possessions she has thrown out, and to avoid seeming homeless, he begins selling them, leading him to make new friendships with his neighbours and gradually straighten out his life. Comedy drama, starring Will Ferrell and Laura Dern

programme.title: Tales That Witness Madness (1973)
programme.desc: A psychiatrist recounts four disturbing cases to a colleague, from a boy with an imaginary tiger to a cannibal luau organised by a literary agent. Director Freddie Francis's horror anthology, starring Donald Pleasence, Jack Hawkins and Kim Novak

programme.title: Jeffrey (1995)
programme.desc: A gay man living in New York at the height of the Aids epidemic becomes celibate out of fear of catching the disease. When he falls for a man who is HIV positive, he is forced to confront his fears concerning both love and mortality. Comedy drama, starring Steven Weber, Patrick Stewart and Sigourney Weaver

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of the amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend.

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Aging in the Wild
programme.desc: Documentary revealing what it is like for animals to grow old, looking at longevity, reproductive health, social status, wisdom and eventual death, as well as examining the unique challenges every species face in the ageing process

programme.title: The Great Way
programme.desc: Alba and Raul start their journey around the world greatest walking trails, a journey that will take them from Japan to Peru, passing through the United States

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton crosses the Sea of the Hebrides to explore the Shiants, once owned by Compton Mackenzie, the author of Whisky Galore. He then heads east to the romantic Isle of Ewe, before taking a kayak trip to the Summer Isles, where he samples a seaweed feast, and on to the cliffs of Handa

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits Islay, travelling from Finlaggan - where the famous ruler Somerled once held court - along the windswept coast, through its historic ports and villages to end on its highest mountain. Along the way he joins dedicated locals keeping the seafaring traditions of the island alive, discovers the secrets of Islay's illicit whisky distilling past and climbs Ben Vicar for a breathtaking view across the Hebrides

programme.title: A Kiss Before Dying (1956)
programme.desc: A psychopathic college student is horrified to learn his girlfriend is pregnant, threatening his chances of being accepted into her well-to-do family. In a fit of fury, he murders her and makes it look as if she had committed suicide - only for her sister to show up, taking an uncomfortable degree of interest in the manner of her sibling's death. Thriller, with Robert Wagner, Joanne Woodward, Jeffrey Hunter and Mary Astor

programme.title: The Captive Heart (1946)
programme.desc: A concentration camp escapee assumes the identity of a dead British captain, only to be captured by German forces in the aftermath of Dunkirk. To help maintain the deception while being held as a prisoner of war, he begins a correspondence with the real officer's widow. Second World War drama, starring Michael Redgrave, Jack Warner and Rachel Kempson

programme.title: Brighton Rock (1947)
programme.desc: A baby-faced teenage gangster charms an impressionable waitress into providing him with an alibi for a murder - but she falls head over heels in love with him, leading to his ultimate downfall. Thriller, based on Graham Greene's novel, starring Richard Attenborough, Hermione Baddeley, William Hartnell and Carol Marsh

programme.title: The Waterbabies (1978)
programme.desc: A runaway chimney sweep flees from his wicked master and stumbles across a strange underwater kingdom. As he tries to return to his own world, he discovers he must first save a group of water babies from a deadly foe. Children's adventure based on the novel by Charles Kingsley, starring James Mason, Billie Whitelaw and Tommy Pender

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: A new planet is sighted, and after holding a seance one of the Moonbase crew becomes convinced it is habitable and tries to force Commander Koenig to evacuate all Alphans to live there. Sci-fi adventure, with Martin Landau

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed heads north to investigate a mysterious laird, who he believes is responsible for fish disappearing from the Scottish coast - and maybe the dead diver found stretched on a rack. Patrick Macnee stars

programme.title: Jack & Sarah (1995)
programme.desc: A lawyer's life is turned upside down by his wife's death in childbirth, leaving him to pick up the pieces and raise their daughter with the help of an unconventional American nanny. This emotional romantic comedy strikes a fair balance between sentiment and slush. Richard E Grant, Samantha Mathis, Judi Dench and Ian McKellen are among the experienced cast

programme.title: Everything Must Go (2010)
programme.desc: A man's heavy drinking costs him his job and leads to his wife kicking him out of the house. He sets up home on their lawn, amid all the possessions she has thrown out, and to avoid seeming homeless, he begins selling them, leading him to make new friendships with his neighbours and gradually straighten out his life. Comedy drama, starring Will Ferrell and Laura Dern

programme.title: Dulcima (1971)
programme.desc: A girl treated as a drudge by her family lifts herself from her environment by becoming a housekeeper. Drama, starring John Mills, Carol White and Stuart Wilson

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions. Landing on a space reveals it's hidden contents, which could amount to a prize, or a 'hot spot', which causes contestants to forfeit their gathered winnings
